org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.slip

Class SlipVeluxBridge

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.VeluxBridge
      • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.slip.SlipVeluxBridge

  • @NonNullByDefault
public class SlipVeluxBridge
extends VeluxBridge
    SLIP-based 2nd Level I/O interface towards the Velux bridge.

    It provides methods for pre- and postcommunication as well as a common method for the real communication.

    In addition to the generic VeluxBridge methods, i.e.

    • VeluxBridge.bridgeLogin() for pre-communication,
    • VeluxBridge.bridgeLogout() for post-communication,
    • VeluxBridge.bridgeCommunicate(org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.common.BridgeCommunicationProtocol, boolean) as method for the common communication,
    • VeluxBridge.bridgeAPI() as interfacing method to all interaction prototypes,
    the following class access methods provides the protocol-specific implementation:
    • bridgeDirectCommunicate(org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.common.BridgeCommunicationProtocol, boolean) for SLIP-based communication.
    • bridgeAPI for return all defined protocol-specific implementations which are provided by SlipBridgeAPI.
    Author:
    Guenther Schreiner - Initial contribution.

    • Field Detail

      • logger

        private final org.slf4j.Logger logger

      • COMMUNICATION_TIMEOUT_MSECS

        static final long COMMUNICATION_TIMEOUT_MSECS
        Timeout for sequence of one request with (optional multiple) responses.

        This can only happen if there is an unexpected (undocumented) occurrence of events which has to be discussed along the Velux API documentation.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COMMUNICATION_RETRY_MSECS

        static final long COMMUNICATION_RETRY_MSECS
        Wait interval within sequence after the request and no immediate response.

        This can happen if the bridge is busy due to a specific command to query and collect information from other devices via the io-homecontrol protocol.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • emptyPacket

        private final byte[] emptyPacket

      • connection

        private Connection connection

      • bridgeAPI

        private BridgeAPI bridgeAPI
        Handler passing the interface methods to other classes. Can be accessed via method BridgeAPI.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Destructor.

        De-initializes the binding-wide instance.

        Overrides:
        shutdown in class VeluxBridge

      • bridgeAPI

        public BridgeAPI bridgeAPI()
        Provides information about the base-level communication method and any kind of available gateway interactions.

        Note: the implementation within this class SlipVeluxBridge as inherited from VeluxBridge will return the protocol-specific class implementations.

        The information will be initialized by the corresponding API class SlipBridgeAPI.

        Specified by:
        bridgeAPI in class VeluxBridge
        Returns:
        bridgeAPI of type BridgeAPI contains all possible methods.

      • bridgeDirectCommunicate

        protected boolean bridgeDirectCommunicate(BridgeCommunicationProtocol communication,
                                          boolean useAuthentication)
        Method as implementation of abstract superclass method.

        Initializes a client/server communication towards Velux veluxBridge based on the Basic I/O interface Connection.io(org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.VeluxBridgeInstance, byte[]) and parameters passed as arguments (see below).

        Specified by:
        bridgeDirectCommunicate in class VeluxBridge
        Parameters:
        communication - Structure of interface type SlipBridgeCommunicationProtocol describing the intended communication, that is request and response interactions as well as appropriate URL definition.
        useAuthentication - boolean flag to decide whether to use authenticated communication.
        Returns:
        success of type boolean which signals the success of the communication.

      • lastCommunication

      • bridgeDirectCommunicate

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        success of type boolean which signals the success of the communication.
